Dear FOI Team,
I would be most grateful if you would provide me, under the Freedom of Information Act, details in respect to Carers Service
The details we require are:
1. The current contract dates including any provision for extensions.
2. If relevant, whether the contract has been extended and the current end date.
3. If known, whether a decision has been made on future extensions.
4. When the current contract/s is/are due to be retendered.
5. The current contract value.
6. Any planned changes to the specification when it is retendered.
7. Name of the current provider (or providers if relevant)
8. The name of the senior officer (outside of procurement) responsible for this contract?
9. What are the contractual performance KPI's for this contract?
Thank you for your help.
Yours sincerely

Dear Rose Johnson,
Thank you for your request for information relating to Carers service
contract which we received on 27/08/2024.
In accordance with Section 16(1) of the FOI Act, the Council has a duty to
provide advice and assistance to you, as far as it is reasonable to do so.
We can advise that the Council does not respond to unsolicited requests
regarding sales, procurement and commissioning. Departments must follow a
strict procedure as the council has a responsibility to spend public money
to achieve the best possible value and outcomes for its citizens whilst
maximising the wider social, economic and environmental benefits. We can
direct you to the Council’s website pages for procurement opportunities,
events and how to sell to the Council:
[1]Submitting a bid for a tender opportunity | Sheffield City Council
This concludes your request FOI 1291141
Kind Regards,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ

Dear Rose Johnson,
Thank you for your request for information relating to Carers service
contract which we received on 27/08/2024.
Please find Sheffield City Council’s response to your request set out
below:
We apologise for the response we sent on 27 August 2024, which was wrong.
We are replacing it today with the following:
With regards to Q1,2,3,5,7(a),9 this information is exempt under Section
21 because it is accessible to you by other means. Details of all the
Council's contracts are stored in the Contract Register on the YORTender
portal.
•            You do not need to be registered with YORTender to view the
register, link below.
[1]
https://uk.eu-supply.com/login.asp?B=YOR...
Search the Contract Register
•            click 'Contract Register' on the left-hand side bar on the
home page
•            click 'Extended search'
•            enter 'Sheffield City Council' in the 'Published by' field
•            fill in the additional fields to make your search more
specific
•            click 'Search contracts'
Q6: No information held.
Q7(b): Alexis Chappell, Strategic Director of ACW.
If you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.
The information provided in this response is available for re-use under
the terms of the Open Government Licence v3.0. The terms of the OGL can be
found [2]here. When re-using the information, Sheffield City Council
requires you to include the following attribution statement: “Contains
public sector information obtained from Sheffield City Council and
licensed under the Open Government Licence v3.0.”
If you are unhappy with the response you have received in relation to your
request, you are entitled to have this reviewed. You can ask for an
internal review by replying to this email. Internal review requests should
be submitted within 40 working days from the date of this response.
If you remain dissatisfied with the outcome of your internal review, you
can contact the Information Commissioner’s Office. Please see
[3]
https://ico.org.uk/make-a-complaint/offi...
for further details.
Kind Regards,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
